intro: Epilobium siskiyouense, commonly known as Siskiyou willow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically features upright stems with opposite leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It produces clusters of small, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Epilobium siskiyouense is adapted to grow in moist, often rocky habitats, such as stream banks and meadows.
